SEARCH
Module org.postgresql.pljava
Package org.postgresql.pljava

Interface PLJavaBasedLanguage.UsingTransforms

All Superinterfaces:
PLJavaBasedLanguage
Enclosing interface:
PLJavaBasedLanguage
public static interface PLJavaBasedLanguage.UsingTransforms extends PLJavaBasedLanguage
To be implemented by a language that supports routines declared with TRANSFORM FOR TYPE.

In addition to implementing the abstract method declared here, a language that implements this interface takes up full responsibility for doing whatever must be done to give effect to any such transforms declared on routines that use the language. PostgreSQL itself provides nothing but a way to declare transforms and associate them with routine declarations.

PL/Java will reject, at validation time when possible, any routine declared with TRANSFORM FOR TYPE if the language does not implement this interface.

A language that does implement this interface can learn what transforms are to be applied by calling memo.transforms() in its prepare and/or prepareTrigger methods, and perhaps also in its validation methods to detect configuration issues as early as possible.

    essentialTransformChecks(Transform t)

  • Method Details

    • essentialTransformChecks

      void essentialTransformChecks(Transform t) throws SQLException
      Performs validation checks on a Transform that purports to be usable with this language.

      PL/Java will already have checked that t's language() refers to this language. This method should use best effort to make sure that t's fromSQL() and toSQL() functions are, in fact, functions that this language implementation can use to transform values between t's target PostgreSQL type() and a data type available to this language. See documentation of the fromSQL() and toSQL() methods for more detail on what may need to be checked.

      It is possible for fromSQL() or toSQL() to return a RegProcedure instance for which isValid() is false, which indicates that this language's default from-SQL or to-SQL handling, respectively, is to be used for the transform's type. In such cases, this method should check that this language has a usable default conversion in the indicated direction for that type.

      This method should return normally on success, otherwise throwing an informative exception. Unless there is a more-specific choice, SQLSyntaxErrorException with SQLState 42P17 corresponds to PostgreSQL's invalid_object_definition.

      Throws:
      SQLException
